description: This technique focuses on the proper alignment and positioning required to effectively execute the North-South choke. The key is to maintain a constant, steady pressure against the opponent's neck by aligning your body with theirs and keeping your feet active, avoiding overshooting or losing balance.

sequential_diagram_steps.label: Initial Setup
sequential_diagram_steps.detail: The instructor begins from a side control position, preparing to transition to the North-South choke by clearing the opponent's hands.

sequential_diagram_steps.label: Establishing Connection
sequential_diagram_steps.detail: He moves into the North-South position, securing one arm around the opponent's neck and connecting his hands for the choke grip.

sequential_diagram_steps.label: Proper Body Alignment
sequential_diagram_steps.detail: The instructor emphasizes aligning his shoulder directly with the opponent's neck, ensuring his body is in line with the opponent's to direct all pressure effectively.

sequential_diagram_steps.label: Sustained Pressure and Stability
sequential_diagram_steps.detail: He starts a slow, steady squeeze for the choke, keeping his feet posted on the ground and slightly spread for maximum stability against the opponent's movements, preventing loss of position.
